Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Turban \Tur"ban\, n. [OE. turband, turbant, tolibant, F. turban, It. turbante, Turk. tulbend, dulbend, fr. Per. dulband. Cf. {Tulip}.] 1. A headdress worn by men in the Levant and by most Mohammedans of the male sex, consisting of a cap, and a sash, scarf, or shawl, usually of cotton or linen, wound about the cap, and sometimes hanging down the neck. [1913 Webster]
2. A kind of headdress worn by women. [1913 Webster]
3. (Zo["o]l.) The whole set of whorls of a spiral shell. [1913 Webster]
turban n 1: a traditional Muslim headdress consisting of a long scarf wrapped around the head 2: a small round woman's hat [syn: {pillbox}, {toque}]
